content: this colorwork cowl combines a couple of our favorite things color and cashmere our elmer and elmer tweed fingering bases shine in this simple stranded pattern -- and just wait until you feel the fabric we think you ll really enjoy the shaping built into this piece too -- it falls into a cozy cashmere-forward puddle around your neck sample shown dimond laine elmer fingering in colors gray is my favorite color mc cookie cc1 sweatshirt cc2 and fluorange ac sizes one size finished measurements approx 31 circumference at the bottom tapering to 22 at the top x 14 high yarn requirements *please note these are yarn estimates the amount used will depend on yarn your personal gauge and any modifications you make * dimond laine elmer fingering 80% merino 20% cashmere 205 yards per 50g or 410 yards per 100g and/or dimond laine elmer tweed fingering 70% merino 30% cashmere 200 yards per 50g or 400 yards per 100g 4 skeins total or fingering weight yarn in the following amounts mc 150 yards / 137m cc1 115 yards / 105m cc2 105 yards / 96m ac 70 yards / 64m needles *needles listed are suggested * gauge needle us 3 3 25mm 24 circular needle you may wish to use a 16 circular needle too as you get closer to the top of your cowl tools darning needle 1 marker gauge 24 stitches and 28 rounds = 4 in stockinette stitch in the round using gauge needle blocked 1 https //thelambandkid com/collections/kits
